availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Morris (Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Jane Swink Morris in Breckenridge County, Kentucky, on September 27, 1855. Father of George M. Morris, Francis Morris, and Mary E. Morris. Farm laborer in Breckinridge County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861 to April 28, 1864. Captured at the Battle of Huff's Ferry, Roane County, Tennessee, on November 14, 1863. Died from typhoid fever at Camp Parole, Anne Arundel County, Maryland, on April 28, 1864.

ab.bibl:
